article.headline: Davis leads Pepperdine past BYU 67-61

images.name: 1H BYU T. Haws made Three Point Jumper. Assisted by C. Fischer.
images.caption: 1H (17:56) BYU Tyler Haws made Three Point Jumper. Assisted by Chase Fischer.

article.story:
PROVO, Utah -- Stacy Davis came off the bench for the first time this season and responded with 23 points and 8 rebounds to lead Pepperdine to a 67-61 win over BYU on Thursday.

The Waves (10-5, 3-1 West Coast Conference) never trailed and made all the clutch plays after the Cougars (13-5, 3-2) cut a double-figure deficit to one with 2:03 left.

BYU had a chance to take the lead but Tyler Haws, who led BYU with 26 points, missed a jumper at 1:06.

After Davis made two free throws at 41 seconds, the Cougars, who were 1-12 from 3-point range in the second half, missed. Jeremy Major made two free throws at 23 seconds and then got a breakaway layup for a 66-59 lead.

BYU came in averaging 88.3 points while Pepperdine allowed 62.

Kyle Collinsworth, who had his third triple-double in BYU's last game, had four points and three rebounds.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
